pr_title: Improved messaging for all UnknownHostExceptions. Added ServiceMetadata.servicePartitions().

timeline.bodyText: Friendly is cute, but is perhaps 'Helpful.. Interceptor' a more descriptive name and slightly less jarring?
timeline.author: cenedhryn

replies.bodyText: All class names should be cute! I'll change to Helpful.
replies.author: millems

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this comment is necessary, the context should make it clear
timeline.author: cenedhryn

timeline.bodyText:
I generally prefer to stack the calls on top of each other for readability
  SdkClientException.builder()
                                   .message(error.toString())
                                   .cause(context.exception())
                                   .build();

In this case the code isn't very complex so I am not insisting though. There is a benefit of a one-liner too; the method reads shorter.
timeline.author: cenedhryn

replies.bodyText: Personally, I stack it when it hits the line limit or when I want to draw more attention to it. I don't stack it when I feel like it's straight-forward and want to draw attention away from it so that the reader's eyes focus more on the interesting stuff.
replies.author: millems

timeline.author: cenedhryn

replies.bodyText: That would definitely work. Do you think it's more readable? I'm worried that the long orElse condition might be distracting, but it would definitely be shorter. I'll try it out!
replies.author: millems

replies.bodyText:
I tried it out, and the long orElseGet parameter makes the globalRegionErrorDetails.orElseGet part disappear, so it is hard for me to tell what the code is trying to do, personally.
Moving the orElseGet parameter to a method is about as readable as the current iteration, because you have to jump to a separate function to see what the default message is.
replies.author: millems

replies.bodyText: Yes, I can agree with that. Perhaps text messages isn't the right place to use orElse/orElseGet.
replies.author: cenedhryn

timeline.bodyText: I like this hiding of the ugly getAttribute
timeline.author: cenedhryn

timeline.bodyText: Should you also test that the message does NOT contain "aws-global"?
timeline.author: cenedhryn

replies.bodyText: Sure! I thought the same thing, but it was more code since there isn't a messageDoesNotContain, so I was worried it would just distract. I can throw it in a function, though, since I agree it's something I shouldn't have been lazy about.
replies.author: millems

timeline.author: cenedhryn

replies.bodyText: Wouldn't that cause the test to fail? I'll see if it does...
replies.author: millems

timeline.bodyText: Can you indent these lines in a more readable way?
timeline.author: cenedhryn

replies.bodyText: I thought this was the most readable way :(
replies.author: millems

replies.bodyText: :-). Usually the indentation rules are good but in this case it just ended up like a jumble to me
replies.author: cenedhryn

timeline.message:
Improved messaging for all UnknownHostExceptions. Added ServiceMetadata.servicePartitions().

1. Removed IAM-specific interceptor for UnknownHostExceptions.
2. Added an interceptor for all services that provide additional helpful details on UnknownHostExceptions.
3. Added ServiceMetadata.servicePartitions() to get partition metadata for a specific service. This is used to provide region hints for global services when customers get an UnknownHostException.
4. Remove hard-coded elasticache service metadata, and return to generating it.
5. Add 'aws.s3UseUsEast1RegionalEndpoint' as a system-property equivalent of `AWS_S3_US_EAST_1_REGIONAL_ENDPOINT`

Improved messaging for all UnknownHostExceptions. Added ServiceMetadata.servicePartitions().

1. Removed IAM-specific interceptor for UnknownHostExceptions.
2. Added an interceptor for all services that provide additional helpful details on UnknownHostExceptions.
3. Added ServiceMetadata.servicePartitions() to get partition metadata for a specific service. This is used to provide region hints for global services when customers get an UnknownHostException.
4. Remove hard-coded elasticache service metadata, and return to generating it.
5. Add 'aws.s3UseUsEast1RegionalEndpoint' as a system-property equivalent of `AWS_S3_US_EAST_1_REGIONAL_ENDPOINT`
